DOC.brief_summary: This study describe safety furosemide premature infant risk bronchopulmonary dysplasia determine preliminary effectiveness pharmacokinetics ( PK ) furosemide . Funding Source -- FDA Office Orphan Product Development
DOC.brief_title: Safety Furosemide Premature Infants Risk Bronchopulmonary Dysplasia ( BPD )
DOC.detailed_description: Infants receive placebo furosemide 28 day . Blood sample collect pharmacokinetic analysis.Premature infant randomize receive placebo furosemide dose escalate approach . Follow information collect 7 day last dose 36 week post menstrual age . The final study assessment occur time discharge , early termination transfer .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Receiving positive airway pressure ( nasal continuous airway pressure , nasal intermittent positive pressure ventilation , nasal cannula flow > 1LPM ) mechanical ventilation ( high frequency conventional ) 2 . < 29 week gestational age birth 3 . 728 day postnatal age time first study dose 1 . Exposure diuretic ≤ 72 hour prior first study dose 2 . Previous enrollment dose current study , `` Safety Furosemide Premature Infants Risk Bronchopulmonary Dysplasia '' 3 . Hemodynamically significant patent ductus arteriosus , determine investigator 4 . Major congenital anomaly ( e.g . congenital diaphragmatic hernia , congenital pulmonary adenomatoid malformation ) 5 . Meconium aspiration syndrome 6 . Known allergy diuretic 7 . Serum creatinine > 1.7 mg/dL < 24 hour prior first study dose 8 . BUN > 50 mg/dL < 24 hour prior first study dose 9 . Na < 125 mmol/L < 24 hour prior first study dose 10 . K ≤2.5 mmol/L < 24 hour prior first study dose 11 . Ca ≤ 6 mg/dL < 24 hour prior first study dose 12 . Indirect bilirubin > 10 mg/dL < 24 hour prior first study dose 13 . Any condition would make participant , opinion investigator , unsuitable study
